analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa yang de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: bye ba phrag du ma zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan 'chad pa'i tshe na rtag tu bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pas na 'dir yang de dag thabs cig tu bzhugs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bye ba phrag du ma zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan 'chad pa'i tshe na rtag tu bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu dang thabs cig tu bzhugs pas na 'dir yang de dag thabs cig tu bzhugs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase many tens of millions indicates that, when the Buddha was expounding this sutra to other groups, he was always accompanied by ninety-nine tens of millions. It should be understood that they were also present on this occasion.

original: lha ni lha chen po dang tshangs pa dang gtogs 'dod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha ni lha chen po dang tshangs pa dang gtogs 'dod la sogs pa'o //

original: klu ni 'jog po la sogs pa'o //

original: bltar rung ba zhes bya ba ni mi ma yin pa de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bltar rung ba zhes bya ba ni mi ma yin pa de dag mig gi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'o //

original: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'i chos la dad pa ste de dag dang thabs cig tu bcom ldan 'das spyod lam bzhir 'gro ba'i don mdzad cing bzhugs te de yan chad ni gleng gzhi'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal pa'i chos la dad pa ste de dag dang thabs cig tu bcom ldan 'das spyod lam bzhir 'gro ba'i don mdzad cing bzhugs te de yan chad ni gleng gzhi'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, together with them, acts for the benefit of those who go to the four modes of conduct and abides.üîΩFrom here on is the introduction.

original: rgyud kyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir @217a * //
analyzed: rgyud kyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir @217a * //

analyzed: kha gnyis su gyes pa ni phyogs bcu thams cad du khyab pa'i don to //
translated: The two-pronged vajra means pervading all ten directions.

original: de lta bu'i ye shes byang chub sems dpa'i 'dis lag tu thob pa dang 'dra bar mngon du byas pas na phyag na rdo rje ste ye shes dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes byang chub sems dpa'i 'dis lag tu thob pa dang 'dra bar mngon du byas pas na phyag na rdo rje ste ye shes dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This bodhisattva has actualized such gnosis as if it were in his hand, and therefore he is called VajrapƒÅ·πái, meaning ‚Äúendowed with gnosis.‚Äù

analyzed: rgyud 'dir dngos po de kho na nyid bcu drug gis bstan te de yang gang zhe na /

analyzed: bdag gi de kho na dang / lha'i de kho na dang / dam tshig dang dkyil 'khor dang shes rab dang / thabs dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i de kho na rnams so //
translated: the reality of oneself, the reality of the deity, the reality of the pledge, the reality of the ma·πá·∏çala, the reality of wisdom, the reality of method, and the reality of cause and effect.

original: de kho na zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang / kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis de chos kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa brjod du med pa'i ngo bo ni don dam pa'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba ni don dam pa dang / kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis de chos kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa brjod du med pa'i ngo bo ni don dam pa'i de kho na'o //
translated: What is called reality is the two kinds: the ultimate and the conventional. The nature of phenomena, unmistaken and inexpressible, is the ultimate reality.

analyzed: de lta mod kyi kun rdzob tu 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang sbyar na /

original: mi slu bar dgos pa bsgrub pas na de kho na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi slu bar dgos pa bsgrub pas na de kho na zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äújust that‚Äù because it is necessary to accomplish the non-deceptive goal.

original: bcu drug po de rnams kyis ji ltar rigs par don grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu drug po de rnams kyis ji ltar rigs par don grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These sixteen accomplish the goal in whatever way is appropriate.

original: 'di rnams kyang ji ltar rigs par sbyar gyi rim bzhin du sbyar ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang ji ltar rigs par sbyar gyi rim bzhin du sbyar ba ni ma yin no //
translated: These are to be applied in whatever way is appropriate, but not in the order in which they are presented.

analyzed: de la snying po ni rigs lnga so so'i snying po yi ge 'bru gcig la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //

original: phyag rgya ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The ‚Äúseals‚Äù are of four kinds:

analyzed: phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / chos kyi phyag rgya dang las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'o //
translated: the great seal, the pledge seal, the doctrine seal, and the action seal.

original: de la phyag rgya chen po ni lha rnams kyi lus kyi tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la phyag rgya chen po ni lha rnams kyi lus kyi tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: The ‚Äúgreat seal‚Äù is the display of the body style of the deities.

original: lus kyi sgo nas lha'i tshul gsal bar bsgom pa'i rgyur che bas na phyag rgya chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas lha'i tshul gsal bar bsgom pa'i rgyur che bas na phyag rgya chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúgreat seal‚Äù because it is the cause for the clear cultivation of the divine style by means of the body.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni lha rnams kyi sems kyi tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni lha rnams kyi sems kyi tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: The ‚Äúpledge seal‚Äù is the display of the mind style of the deities.

original: sems kyi rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma phyag rgyar bstan pas lha rnams kyang de las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig gi phyag rgyar bstan pas dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam par thar pa'i mtshan ma phyag rgyar bstan pas lha rnams kyang de las mi 'da' bas na dam tshig gi phyag rgyar bstan pas dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes pa'o //
translated: Since the signs of the mind's liberation are taught as the seal, even the gods do not transgress it, so it is taught as the pledge seal.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya ni lha rnams kyi tshig gi tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni lha rnams kyi tshig gi tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: The doctrine seal is the teaching of the mode of the words of the deities.

original: lha rnams @217b kyi tshig don dam pa'i chos thams cad ston pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams @217b kyi tshig don dam pa'i chos thams cad ston pa'o //
translated: The words of the deities teach all the ultimate doctrines.

original: las kyi phyag rgya ni spyod pa'i tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya ni spyod pa'i tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: The action seal is the teaching of the mode of conduct.

original: phyag rgya rdo rje khu tshur gnyis su dral ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya rdo rje khu tshur gnyis su dral ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The action seal is the unbinding of the two vajra fists and so forth.

original: sngags ni shes pa dang skyob par ldan pas na sngags te /
analyzed: sngags ni shes pa dang skyob par ldan pas na sngags te /
translated: The mantra is the knowledge and protection of the mantra.

original: don ma nor bar shes pas ngan song gsum las skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ma nor bar shes pas ngan song gsum las skyob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the meaning is known without error, it protects from the three lower realms.

original: de yang lha'i sku gzugs skyes pa'i cha lugs 'dzin pa rnams kyis gsungs pa'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: de yang lha'i sku gzugs skyes pa'i cha lugs 'dzin pa rnams kyis gsungs pa'i tshig rnams so //
translated: Moreover, the words spoken by the deities who hold the form of a born body.

original: rig pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir lha bud med kyi tshul du bzhugs pa'i tshe gsungs pa'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: rig pa ni ma rig pa'i mun pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir lha bud med kyi tshul du bzhugs pa'i tshe gsungs pa'i tshig rnams so //
translated: VidyƒÅ is the words spoken when abiding in the form of a male or female deity in order to dispel all the darkness of ignorance.

original: byin gyis brlab pa ni rnam pa gnyis te rang bzhin gyis byin gyis brlab pa dang / mthus byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa ni rnam pa gnyis te rang bzhin gyis byin gyis brlab pa dang / mthus byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Blessing is of two kinds: natural blessing and blessing through power.

original: byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga yang bdag rang phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor la gnas shing /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga yang bdag rang phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor la gnas shing /
translated: The ritual of blessing is as follows: I myself abide in the yoga of the great seal.

original: dam tshig dang dbab pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas lha gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig dang dbab pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas lha gnas par bya'o //
translated: The deity is caused to abide through seals such as the pledge seal and the wisdom seal.

original: dbang bskur ba ni rnam pa gnyis te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni mchod pa'i don du me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pas dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni rnam pa gnyis te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la ni mchod pa'i don du me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pas dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: Consecration is of two kinds: for the Blessed Buddhas, consecration with flower garlands and so forth for the purpose of worship;

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan gyis dbang bskur ba dang / ming gis dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan gyis dbang bskur ba dang / ming gis dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: for Bodhisattvas and so forth, consecration with the crown of the five Buddhas and with the name consecration, and so forth.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the mental attention to the door of liberation.

original: mchod pa ni bdag dang gzhan la mchod pa ste phyi nang gi mchod pa rnam pa brgyad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni bdag dang gzhan la mchod pa ste phyi nang gi mchod pa rnam pa brgyad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Worship is the worship of oneself and others, the eight kinds of outer and inner worship, and so forth.

original: bdag gi de kho na ni bdag gi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi de kho na ni bdag gi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: One's reality is the unerring nature of oneself,

analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin mi skye mi 'gog pa stod pa nyid do //
translated: the nature of the selflessness of phenomena, which is taught as non-arising and non-ceasing.

original: lha'i de kho na ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lha'i de kho na ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The reality of the deity is twofold, ultimate and conventional.

original: don dam par na lha'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid mi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par na lha'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid mi gnyis pa'o //
translated: Ultimately, the nature of the deity is emptiness, non-duality.

original: kun rdzob tu ni yan lag thams cad ldan par skyes pa dang bud med dang / khro bo dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni yan lag thams cad ldan par skyes pa dang bud med dang / khro bo dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
translated: Conventionally, it appears in the form of a male or female deity, wrathful or peaceful, complete with all the limbs.

original: dam tshig ni spyir sngags pa thams cad kyis bsrung ba dang / rigs tha dad pa'i dam tshig tha dad par bsrung ba rnams so //
analyzed: dam tshig ni spyir sngags pa thams cad kyis bsrung ba dang / rigs tha dad pa'i dam tshig tha dad par bsrung ba rnams so //
translated: Vow is the general vow to be guarded by all mantra practitioners and the specific vows to be guarded by the different families.

original: dkyil 'khor ni rigs re re zhing yang dkyil 'khor bzhi la sogs pa re re yang bzhi bzhir bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni rigs re re zhing yang dkyil 'khor bzhi la sogs pa re re yang bzhi bzhir bshad pa'o //
translated: The mandala is explained as four mandalas for each of the four lineages, and so on.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu shes pa ste de kho na bcu drug la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la @218a * //
